perturbation.changed_text:
15.  TERM
     The term of this Agreement will begin on the Effective Date. The agreement will automatically renew indefinitely after three (3) years from the date the Co-Branded Application becomes accessible to Excite@Home Members ("Launch Date"), unless either party provides a written notice of termination within 30 days of an upcoming renewal date. Such termination notice must be delivered at least three months before any auto-renewal anniversary.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states a three-year term. The modified version introduces an auto-renewal clause, contradicting the fixed term and creating uncertainty about the contract's duration. The clause creates an ambiguity regarding whether the agreement terminates after three years or continues indefinitely unless actively cancelled. This uncertainty could cause disagreements and legal challenges.

perturbation.original_text:
18.  CONFIDENTIALITY
     a)   For the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" means
          information about the disclosing party's (or its suppliers') business
          or activities that is proprietary and confidential, which shall
          include all business, financial, technical and other information of a
          party marked or designated by such party as "confidential" or
          "proprietary"; or information which, by the nature of the
          circumstances surrounding the disclosure, ought in good faith to be
          treated as confidential.
perturbation.changed_text:
18.  CONFIDENTIALITY
     a)   For the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" means
          information about the disclosing party's (or its suppliers') business
          or activities that is proprietary and confidential, which shall
          include all business, financial, technical and other information of a
          party marked or designated by such party as "confidential" or
          "proprietary"; or information which, by the nature of the
          circumstances surrounding the disclosure, ought in good faith to be
          treated as confidential. However, after one year from the date of disclosure, such information will no longer be considered confidential.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of Confidential Information sets a standard of ongoing confidentiality. The added clause restricts this by stating that after one year, such information is no longer confidential. This contradicts the general principle of continuous confidentiality and creates ambiguity regarding which information remains protected and for how long. This contradiction could lead to disputes and compromise sensitive information.

perturbation.changed_text:
22.  GENERAL
     b) Assignment. Either party may assign this Agreement, in whole or in
        part, without the other party's written consent (which will not be
        unreasonably withheld), except that no such consent will be required in
        connection with a merger, reorganization or sale of all, or
        substantially all, of such party's assets or capital stock. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Excite@Home may assign this agreement to any of its subsidiaries at its sole discretion, without seeking e-centives' approval. Any attempt to assign this Agreement other than as permitted above will be null and void.
perturbation.explanation: The original assignment clause requires mutual consent for any assignment, except in specific scenarios like mergers. The modification introduces an exception specifically for Excite@Home, allowing them to assign the agreement to its subsidiaries without e-centives' approval. This creates a contradiction, as it gives Excite@Home unilateral assignment rights, conflicting with the initially stated mutual consent requirement. This imbalance could disadvantage e-centives and lead to disputes.
